definitions.definition: A writing utensil with a graphite (commonly referred to as lead ) shaft , usually blended with clay , clad in wood, and sharpened to a taper.
An aggregate or collection of rays of light , especially when diverging from, or converging to, a point.
A family of geometric objects with a common property , such as the set of lines that pass through a given point in a projective plane.
Ellipsis of power of the pencil .

main_definition: ( now chiefly historical ) A paintbrush . [from 14th c.]
secondary_definitions: A writing utensil with a graphite (commonly referred to as lead ) shaft , usually blended with clay , clad in wood, and sharpened to a taper. [from 16th c.]
( optics ) An aggregate or collection of rays of light , especially when diverging from, or converging to, a point. [from 17th c.]
( geometry ) A family of geometric objects with a common property , such as the set of lines that pass through a given point in a projective plane. [from 19th c.]
( medicine , obsolete , rare ) A small medicated bougie . [19th c.]
( gambling ) Ellipsis of power of the pencil .
